items.title: Full Time: Physics programmer for videogames (Unreal Engine) at DCL Drone Champions League in remote
items.content:
DCL is seeking an experienced and talented physics programmer to join our team, for the develompent of our Drone Champions Game and other project, not exclusively related to game develompment.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nRcKZUBwhTgSpecifically this is an exciting opportunity to study and digitally synthesize the behavior of flying machines into software and integrate it in Unreal Engine.

LOCATION

We will consider applications for remote work, but it would be mandatory to physically work from DCL offices in Ruggel (Liecthenstein) during the initial phase of the project, for at least a two months.

RESPONSIBILITIES

The videogame project is in its infancy and the candidate would be part of the Core Team that directs its development.Depending on the capabilitites of the candidate, the role can evolve into a Lead / Head level of responsibilities, as the Team grows.As well as possessing the math and programming skills the candidate must be able to communicate with clarity and confidence in English (any level of German would be useful but optional).

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • 3+ years programming experience.
  • Fluency in C/C++
  • Familiarity with existing physics packages and PhysX
  • Physics/mathematics/computer science degree
  • Familiarity with Unreal Engine or other game engines
  • Outstanding math skills (linear algebra, trigonometry, matrix/quaternion math)
  • Self-motivation.
  • Written and spoken English

ADDITIONAL VALUABLE QUALIFICATIONS

  • 3+ years physics programming experience.
  • Assembly, and SIMD programming.
  • Experience of low level optimizations and fixing stability issues
  • Proven experience with Unreal Engine
  • Experience with Simulink
  • Strong multi-threaded programming skills.

items.title: Full Time: Remote Senior Unity3D Developer for Syncity.com - EU Area at Syncity.com in Remote position
items.content:
Unleash the limitations of the physical world with a state-of-the-art simulation platform. We are developing a Unity desktop application to simulate environments for autonomous vehicles/applications. We are looking for experienced REMOTE Unity3D developers, we will value experience with:

  • Shaders development (raytracing and/or post processing effects)
  • Desktop performance optimization (specially rendering optimization)We offer:
  • Young Funded Start -Up company with Clients and endless opportunities In the most interesting and practical Industry of the Future.
  • Challenging and interesting long term project
  • Remote position-Full Time position-Please mention at the Subject the job title and the country you live in. Please send your CV to: jobs@cvedia.comhttps://syncity.com - Simulating the world for autonomous applications

items.title: Game Changer MVP: Software Architect & Interactive Director
items.content:
Software Architect & Interactive Director

Posted Jan 6

Game Changer MVP
Headquarters: Dallas, TX
www.gcmvp.com


DUTIES &RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

·      Software Design - Game Changerapplications are multiple pieces of software that are interconnected. Designeach individual component (detailing the behaviors the component should have),define the ways in which those components communicate, and compile thisinformations into a formal document This ‘spec sheet’ is given to eachdevelopment team to implement

 

·      DevOps - Code pushed to Git repositoriesis automatically built and deployed via a CI/CD system (CircleCI). Monitor thehealth of already created applications, and design new systems of continuousintegration and deployment to meet the needs of new applications

 

 

·      Release Management - While mostapplications are deployed to the web or embedded in other applications, othersare built to be release on the App/Play store. Know the release process of bothiOS and Android platforms

 

·      Code Review - New code will be submitteddaily by developers. It should be checked for errors and that it follows bestpractices

 

·      Client Communication - Strongcommunication skills to work with engineers from other companies, as GameChanger applications are often integrated into other companies products andapplications

·      Staff Management - Manages software and development staff in day to day operationsalong with weekly calls and oversight of deadlines and deliverables

·      Internal Communication – Handles updates to all Game Changer staff relevantto deadlines, software and app updates, new game development and otherinteractive items as required

 

 

JOB REQUIRMENTS:

 

  • Minimum of a 4-year Bachelor’s degree or educational equivalent
  • High level communication skills dealing with internal and external parties
  • Strong personnel management, communication, time management and organizational skills. 
  • Proven ability to multi-task and manage projects on strict deadlines
  • Has had previous experience and possesses intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Office, Google Docs, and Gmail Suite
  • Excellent ability to work with and maintain positive work relationships with co-workers, managers, and executives and clients
  • Able to work flexible hours including evening, weekend, holidays as needed
  • Professional image and demeanor
  • Some travel to meet and work with clients or set up/work events
  • Possess very high degree of discretion and professionalism
·      Required proficiencies: Angular (notAngular1/AngularJS), Typescript, Git
·      Technologies used that will need to be learned:Pubnub, Google Cloud Platform, CircleCI, GitHub, Electron, Firebase
·      Additionally, Unreal Engine experience ishelpful but not necessary
 

The perfect candidate is a self-starter who knows how to manage a team of people.  Previous game development and/or app development experience a must, basic knowledge of Unreal, Unity, JSON, IOS and Android Structure also is a plus. This is full time position that will allow for remote working. Our company is a virtual office where everyone works around the US and internationally.

Apply for this position

Send a resume to shopkins@gcmvp.com

items.title: Conductor Technologies | Oakland, CA / San Francisco Bay Area / REMOTE OK (US/Canada only) | Full-time | $100k-$130k + equity | Team of 7 engineers ...
items.content:
Conductor Technologies | Oakland, CA / San Francisco Bay Area / REMOTE OK (US/Canada only) | Full-time | $100k-$130k + equity | Team of 7 engineers in the SF bay area and on the East coast

Back-end software engineer (proficiency in Python required)

https://www.conductortech.com

https://goo.gl/rgjRfW (full job description)

Our mission is to lead the transition from on-premises infrastructure to cloud-based, infinitely scalable and on-demand resources for VFX and Animation rendering, simulation and beyond.

What to expect:

- In your first 90 days: you’ll contribute to existing microservices in Python and help maintain our legacy Python AppEngine codebase. You’ll contribute to architectural discussions, participate in code reviews, and you’ll deploy your services automatically through our CI/CD pipeline.

- In your first 6 months: you’ll design, write and own microservices written in Python and/or Go, and help migrate our existing services to AWS.

- By the end of your first year: you’ll write lambda functions on AWS, and own several services written in Python and/or Go.

If any of this sounds interesting, we'd love to hear from you! Feel free to reach out to me directly, using the subject “Back-end SWE: HN 1/18”: francois {at} conductortech.com

items.title: Enjin Coin - Lead Unity and C# Developer
items.content:
Enjin Coin - Lead Unity and C# Developer - Jobmote

Enjin Coin - Lead Unity and C# Developer

Enjin Pte Ltd

Interested in game development and cryptocurrencies? Enjin Coin (ENJ) is looking for an experienced Unity developer to join us in developing our cutting-edge framework for crypto-based game assets on the Ethereum blockchain.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Developing a Unity Plugin that integrates with multiple item/inventory system plugins
  • Writing a clean SDK for game developers
  • Writing JSON-RPC requests to communicate with an API
  • Creating a logical interface for game developers to use inside Unity
  • Writing a base C# SDK with similar functionality

Requirements

  • Excellent knowledge of the Unity Engine
  • Experience developing plugins for Unity
  • Knowledge of item/inventory systems in Unity
  • 5+ years programming experience
  • 1+ year C# experience
  • Great written and spoken English
  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming
  • Familiarity with design patterns
  • Good at writing clean, readable, and easily maintainable code
  • Experience writing unit tests

This is a remote full-time position, so you have to be self-motivated and put in consistent development and daily progress. Minimum commitment of 35-40 hours per week.

items.title: Full Time: Senior Software Engineer for Digital Health Startup at BrainCheck in Houston, TX (remote considered)
items.content:
Company & position overview
BrainCheck is an innovative cognitive health technology company co-founded by neuroscientists Dr. David Eagleman and Dr. Yael Katz. The company recently completed its post-seed fundraising and has market traction with schools and athletic teams, physicians offices, and hospitals. The startup team is operating out of Texas Medical Center’s Innovation Center (TMCX+) in Houston.

As we scale our user-adoption and build out exciting new features in the application, we are looking for an experienced engineer to join the team and help drive product innovation. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver who can respond quickly to changing business needs. If this sounds like you and you’re excited to solve big challenges at the cutting edge of healthcare, then reach out and let’s talk.

Key responsibilities:
*Feature development and maintenance for codebases in Ruby on Rails, Unity, and Ember.
*Maintenance of the automated testing and deployment systems (Jenkins and Travis).
*BrainCheck app deployment and management on AWS.
*Integrating partner apps, such as health monitoring and EMR platforms, with BrainCheck systems.
*Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment a must

Required skills include:
*5+ years of experience working as a software developer
*Working knowledge of modern front-end development and javascript proficiency
*Test driven development procedures and tools
*Familiarity with Unity3D and/or Rails a big plus
*Use of AWS technologies, including EC2, CodeDeploy, and S3, a plus
*Experience building, deploying, and maintaining iOS and Android apps a plus

Working at BrainCheck:
*Join a vibrant team, collaborating to pioneer cognitive health
*Early-stage startup with significant upside potential
*Headquartered at TMCX+ – home to dozens of the most innovative startups and innovation labs in the healthcare industry
*We work hard but like to have fun, including happy-hours, ping-pong and other games
*Competitive compensation consisting of cash and equity

More about the Company
BrainCheck takes gold-standard neurocognitive tests and turns them into mobile interactive games, providing a snapshot of an individual’s cognitive health in about 10 minutes. Our current market offering, BrainCheck Sport, assesses cognitive deficits associated with concussion in sports and athletics, and we also have a direct to consumer version available for iPad and iPhone. Our newly released BrainCheck Memory assesses cognitive and memory impairment associated with dementia, and we are developing a generalized cognitive health tracking tool for the healthy population. BrainCheck has reinvented the process of cognitive assessment to be faster, less expensive, and as reliable as conventional methods.

BrainCheck was developed at the Eagleman Neuroscience Laboratory at Baylor College of Medicine. Dr. David Eagleman has done groundbreaking work on neurocognitive assessment, and he is also a public educator, authoring New York Times bestselling books and appearing regularly on television (most recently PBS’s series The Brain with David Eagleman). David is joined by CEO, Dr. Yael Katz, neuroscientist and technology executive, and a team of ten outstanding individuals in product, software development, clinical research, marketing, business development, and sales.

No agencies / recruiters, please
